content: KL3 3373582.5 LOAN AGREEMENT Dated as of June 2, 2022 Between TIDES ON BOCA RATON SOUTH OWNER, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as Borrower and ACM CRE FUND I-L, LP, a Delaware limited partnership, as Lender

Sch. 6.3.5-1 KL3 3373582.5 LOAN AGREEMENT THIS LOAN AGREEMENT (as the same may be modified, supplemented, amended or otherwise changed, this “Agreement”), dated as of June 2, 2022 (the “Closing Date”), is entered into between TIDES ON BOCA RATON SOUTH OWNER, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (together with its successors and permitted assigns, “Borrower”), and ACM CRE FUND I-L, LP, a Delaware limited partnership (together with its successors and assigns, “Lender”). RECITALS WHEREAS, Borrower has requested that Lender make a loan in the maximum principal amount of Thirteen Million Eight Hundred Seventeen Thousand Seven Hundred Ninety- Eight and No/100 Dollars ($13,817,798.00) (the “Loan”) to be secured by, among other things, a first priority deed of trust lien on that certain real property legally described on Exhibit A attached hereto; and WHEREAS, Lender has agreed to make the Loan subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the above recitals and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Borrower and Lender hereby agree as follows: 1. DEFINITIONS; PRINCIPLES OF CONSTRUCTION 1.1 Specific Definitions. The following terms have the meanings set forth below: Acceptable Appraisal: shall mean an appraisal ordered by Lender at the expense of Borrower that is (i) dated not more than sixty (60) days prior to the applicable date of calculation required pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, (ii) signed by a qualified, independent MAI appraiser selected by Lender, (iii) addressed to Lender and its successors and assigns, (iv) made in compliance with the requirements of Title XI of the Federal Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 and the regulations promulgated thereunder, and (v) otherwise satisfactory to Lender in all material respects, in its sole discretion. Acceptable Counterparty: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 2.6.1 hereof. Additional Borrower Equity: means Five Hundred Forty-Three Thousand One Hundred Fifty-Eight and No/100 Dollars ($543,158.00) of cash equity (and not Loan proceeds) in excess of the Required Minimum Equity, to be contributed by Borrower’s constituent owners to Borrower after the date hereof for payment by the Borrower of 50% of the costs of the Approved Initial CapEx in connection with Lender making an advance hereunder for the other 50% of the costs of such Approved Initial CapEx; provided, however, that the Additional Borrower Equity

Sch. 6.3.5-2 KL3 3373582.5 shall not be required prior to Lender having advanced or disbursed $1,000,000 in the aggregate from the Initial CapEx Reserve. Affiliate: shall mean, as to any Person, any other Person (i) which directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries Controls, or is Controlled by, or is under common Control with, such Person; or (ii) which, directly or indirectly, beneficially owns or holds ten percent (10%) or more of any class of stock or any other ownership interest in such Person; or (iii) ten percent (10%) or more of the direct or indirect ownership of which is beneficially owned or held by such Person; or (iv) which is a member of the family (as defined in Section 267(c)(4) of the Code) of such Person or which is a trust or estate, the beneficial owners of which are members of the family (as defined in Section 267(c)(4) of the Code) of such Person; or (v) which directly or indirectly is a general partner, controlling shareholder, managing member, officer, director, trustee or employee of such Person. Alternate Rate: shall mean, with respect to each applicable Interest Period, the Alternate Rate Spread plus a fluctuating rate per annum equal to the Alternate Rate Index (expressed as a percentage per annum rounded upwards, if necessary, to the nearest one hundredth (1/100th) of one percent (1%)) for deposits in U.S. Dollars for a one (1) month period, as determined by Lender on the date that is two (2) Business Days prior to the first day of such Interest Period. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall the Alternate Rate be an amount less than the Spread plus the Index Floor. Alternate Rate Conversion Conforming Changes: shall mean, in connection with any conversion from the Benchmark to the Alternate Rate Index in accordance with Section 2.8(2) hereof, any technical, administrative or operational changes (including changes to the definition of “Interest Period”, timing and frequency of determining rates of interest and other administrative matters), that Lender decides in good faith may be appropriate to reflect the adoption of such Alternate Rate Index in a manner substantially consistent with market practice (or, if Lender decides that adoption of any portion of such market practice is not administratively feasible or if Lender or its designee determines that no market practice for use of the Alternate Rate Index exists, in such other manner as Lender determines (in a manner generally consistent with Lender’s determinations in similar contexts for similar loans) is necessary). Alternate Rate Index: shall mean a substitute index selected by Lender, which substitute index shall be a published index that Lender determines is then-currently used by lenders in making determinations of the interest rate for variable rate commercial real estate loans (in a manner generally consistent with Lender’s determinations in similar contexts for similar loans), which the parties hereto acknowledge and agree may be an index that does not yet exist and/or is not commonly being used as of the Closing Date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall the Alternate Rate Index be an amount less than the Index Floor. Alternate Rate Spread: shall mean, in connection with any conversion from the Benchmark to the Alternate Rate Index in accordance with Section 2.8(2) hereof, the difference (expressed as the number of basis points) of (a) the Benchmark plus the Spread as of the Interest Period immediately preceding such conversion, minus (b) the Alternate Rate Index as of such conversion. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (x) in no event shall the Alternate Rate Spread be an amount less than zero and (y) in lieu of the foregoing calculation, Lender may elect (in a manner

Sch. 6.3.5-3 KL3 3373582.5 generally consistent with Lender’s determinations in similar contexts for similar loans) at the time of conversion from the Benchmark to an Alternate Rate Index, to apply its or any then customary alternate rate index and/or spread adjustment methodology then commonly used by lenders for variable rate commercial real estate loans. Annual Budget: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 6.3.5 hereof. Approved Annual Budget: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 6.3.5 hereof. Approved Budget Capital Expense: shall mean the Capital Expenses incurred by Borrower which are either (i) included in the Approved Capital Budget for the applicable calendar month or (ii) approved in writing by Lender. Approved Capital Budget: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 6.3.5 hereof. Approved Initial CapEx: shall mean the capital improvements and other work set forth in the Initial CapEx Budget and the Initial CapEx Proposed Scope of Work, or otherwise approved in writing by Lender. Approved Lease: shall mean (i) each Lease described on the Rent Roll as of the Closing Date, (ii) any Approved Parameters Lease, and (iii) any other Lease approved in writing by Lender (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed so long as such Lease is not with a Borrower Party or its Affiliate). Approved Operating Budget: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 6.3.5 hereof. Approved Operating Expenses: shall mean operating expense(s) incurred by Borrower which (i) are included in the Approved Operating Budget for the applicable calendar month, (ii) are for real estate taxes, insurance premiums, electric, gas, oil, water, sewer or other utility service to the Property or (iii) have been approved by Lender; provided, however, that absent the express written consent of Lender, Approved Operating Expenses shall not include any asset management fees, acquisition fees, construction management fees or any similar fees due and owing to any Affiliate of Borrower. Approved Parameters Lease: shall mean a Lease consistent with the Permitted Use which (i) is on a form of lease approved by Lender, with any material changes thereto approved by Lender (in each case, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed); (ii) demises a single rental apartment at the Property and is not with a tenant that, together with its Affiliates, leases three (3) or more apartments at the Property; (iii) provides for terms comparable in all material respects to existing local market terms (taking into account the type and quality of the tenant) as of the date such Lease is executed (but in no event provides for more than two (2) months of free rent in any twelve (12) month period); (iv) is with a tenant that is creditworthy, as reasonably determined by Borrower; (v) is an arm’s-length transaction with a tenant that is not an Affiliate of any Borrower Party; (vi) does not violate applicable Legal Requirements (including with respect to zoning) or the terms of any other Approved Lease; (vii) does not require the

Sch. 6.3.5-4 KL3 3373582.5 Borrower, as landlord, to provide parking for the tenant unless Borrower has sufficient parking available on the Property to satisfy such obligation after giving effect to all other rights of tenants under Approved Leases in respect of parking; (viii) provides for automatic self-operative subordination to the Security Instrument and attornment to Lender; (ix) does not contain any option to purchase or any right of first refusal to purchase; and (x) is for an initial term of not less than twelve (12) months (or an initial term of not less than six (6) months if less than ten percent (10%) of the apartments at the Property are then subject to Leases with initial terms of less than twelve (12) months) and, together with all extensions, does not exceed a term of two (2) years. Assignment of Agreements: shall mean that certain Assignment of Agreements, Licenses, Permits and Contracts from Borrower to Lender, dated as of the Closing Date, as the same may be amended, restated or supplemented from time to time. Assignment of Interest Rate Protection Agreement: shall mean that certain Collateral Assignment of Interest Rate Protection Agreement by and between Borrower and Lender, dated as of the Closing Date, as the same may be amended, restated or supplemented from time to time. Assignment of Leases and Rents: shall mean that certain Assignment of Leases and Rents dated the Closing Date by Borrower to Lender, as the same may be amended, restated or supplemented from time to time. Assignment and Subordination of Property Management Agreement: shall mean that certain Collateral Assignment and Subordination of Property Management Agreement by and among Borrower, Manager and Lender, dated as of the Closing Date, as the same may be amended, restated, supplemented or replaced from time to time. Award: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 7.3.2 hereof. Bankruptcy Code: shall mean Section 362(a) of Title 11 of the United States Code, as amended and as it may be further amended from time to time. Bankruptcy Proceeding: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 4.7 hereof. Benchmark: shall mean, initially, Term SOFR; provided that if a Benchmark Transition Event and its related Benchmark Replacement Date have occurred with respect to the then-current Benchmark, then “Benchmark” means the applicable Benchmark Replacement to the extent that such Benchmark Replacement has replaced such prior benchmark rate pursuant to Section 2.10 hereof. Lender shall determine the Benchmark (and the applicable Reference Time) as in effect from time to time, and each such determination by Lender shall be conclusive and binding absent manifest error. Benchmark Conforming Changes: shall mean, with respect to either the use or administration of Term SOFR or the use, administration, adoption or implementation of any Benchmark Replacement, any technical, administrative or operational changes (including changes to the definition of “Business Day,” the definition of “Interest Period,” the definition of “Reference Time,” the timing and frequency of determining rates of interest, the applicability and length of

Sch. 6.3.5-5 KL3 3373582.5 lookback periods, the applicability of breakage provisions and other technical, administrative or operational matters) that Lender decides may be appropriate to reflect the adoption and implementation of such Benchmark Replacement and to permit the administration thereof by Lender in a manner substantially consistent with market practice (or, if Lender decides that adoption of any portion of such market practice is not administratively feasible or if Lender determines that no market practice for the administration of such Benchmark Replacement exists, in such other manner of administration as Lender decides is reasonably necessary in connection with the administration of this Agreement and the other Loan Documents); provided that Benchmark Conforming Changes shall be determined by Lender in a manner generally consistent with Lender’s determinations in similar contexts for similar loans. Benchmark Replacement: shall mean the first alternative set forth in the order below that can be determined by Lender for the applicable Benchmark Replacement Date: (1) the sum of: (a) Compounded SOFR and (b) the related Benchmark Replacement Adjustment; or (2) the sum of: (a) the alternate rate of interest that has been selected or recommended by the Relevant Governmental Body as the replacement for the then-current Benchmark and (b) the related Benchmark Replacement Adjustment; or (3) the sum of: (a) the ISDA Fallback Rate and (b) the related Benchmark Replacement Adjustment; or (4) the sum of: (a) the alternate benchmark rate that has been selected by Lender as the replacement for the then-current Benchmark giving due consideration to any industry- accepted market convention for determining a rate of interest as a replacement for the then- current Benchmark for U.S. dollar-denominated floating rate CMBS loans at such time and (b) the related Benchmark Replacement Adjustment; provided that, in the case of clauses (2) and (3) above, such rate, or the underlying rates component thereof, is or are displayed on a screen or other information service that publishes such rate or rates from time to time selected by Lender in its reasonable discretion. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the Benchmark Replacement as determined pursuant to clause (1), (2), (3) or (4) above would be less than the Index Floor, then the Benchmark Replacement will be deemed to be the Index Floor for the purposes of this Agreement and the other Loan Documents. Benchmark Replacement Adjustment: shall mean, with respect to any replacement of the then current Benchmark with an Unadjusted Benchmark Replacement, the first alternative set forth in the order below that can be determined by Lender for the applicable Benchmark Replacement Date: (1) the spread adjustment, or method for calculating or determining such spread adjustment (which may be a positive or negative value or zero), that has been selected or recommended by the Relevant Governmental Body for the applicable Unadjusted Benchmark Replacement; or

Sch. 6.3.5-6 KL3 3373582.5 (2) if the applicable Unadjusted Benchmark Replacement is equivalent to the ISDA Fallback Rate, then the ISDA Fallback Adjustment; or (3) the spread adjustment, or method for calculating or determining such spread adjustment (which may be a positive or negative value or zero) that has been selected by Lender giving due consideration to any industry-accepted spread adjustment, or method for calculating or determining such spread adjustment, for the replacement of the then- current Benchmark with the applicable Unadjusted Benchmark Replacement for U.S. dollar-denominated floating rate CMBS loans at such time; provided that, in the case of clause (1) and (2) above, such adjustment is displayed on a screen or other information service that publishes such Benchmark Replacement Adjustment from time to time as selected by Lender in its reasonable discretion. Benchmark Replacement Date: shall mean the earliest to occur of the following events with respect to the then-current Benchmark: (1) in the case of clause (1) or (2) of the definition of “Benchmark Transition Event,” the later of (a) the date of the public statement or publication of information referenced therein and (b) the date on which the administrator of such Benchmark permanently or indefinitely ceases to provide such Benchmark; and (2) in the case of clause (3) of the definition of “Benchmark Transition Event,” the first date on which such Benchmark has been determined and announced by or on behalf of the administrator of such Benchmark or the regulatory supervisor for the administrator of such Benchmark to be non-representative or non-compliant with or non-aligned with the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) Principles for Financial Benchmarks; provided that such non-representativeness, non-compliance or non-alignment will be determined by reference to the most recent statement or publication referenced in such clause (3) and even if such Benchmark continues to be provided on such date. Benchmark Transition Event: shall mean the occurrence of one or more of the following events with respect to the then-current Benchmark: (1) a public statement or publication of information by or on behalf of the administrator of such Benchmark announcing that such administrator has ceased or will cease to provide such Benchmark, permanently or indefinitely, provided that, at the time of such statement or publication, there is no successor administrator that will continue to provide such Benchmark; (2) a public statement or publication of information by the regulatory supervisor for the administrator of the Benchmark, the central bank for the currency of the Benchmark, an insolvency official with jurisdiction over the administrator for the Benchmark, a resolution authority with jurisdiction over the administrator for the Benchmark or a court or an entity with similar insolvency or resolution authority over the administrator for the Benchmark, which states that the administrator of the Benchmark has ceased or will cease to provide the Benchmark permanently or indefinitely, provided that, at the time of such

Sch. 6.3.5-7 KL3 3373582.5 statement or publication, there is no successor administrator that will continue to provide the Benchmark; or (3) a public statement or publication of information by or on behalf of the administrator of such Benchmark or the regulatory supervisor for the administrator of such Benchmark announcing that the Benchmark is not, or as of a specified future date will not be, representative or in compliance with or aligned with the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) Principles for Financial Benchmarks. Borrower: shall have the meaning given to such term in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. Borrower Party: shall mean Borrower, Sole Member, Guarantor and any other Person that Controls Borrower. Borrower Provided Information: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 9.1.2 hereof. Broker: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 10.2 hereof. Business Day: shall mean (i) any day other than a Saturday, Sunday or any day on which commercial banks in New York City are authorized or required to close and (ii) with respect to all notices, determinations, fundings and payments in connection with SOFR, any day except for (i) a Saturday, (ii) a Sunday or (iii) a day on which the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association, or any successor thereto, recommends that the fixed income departments of its members be closed for the entire day for purposes of trading in United States Government securities. Calculation Date: shall mean the date ending each Quarter on which Lender determines, based on the monthly reporting required pursuant to Section 6.3.3, the financial covenant or metric for the immediately preceding calendar Quarter(s), as applicable. Capital Expenses: shall mean expenses that are capital in nature or required under GAAP to be capitalized. Cash Management Accounts: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 3.1.1 hereof. Cash Management Period: shall mean any time that (i) a DSCR Cash Management Period is continuing and/or (ii) an Event of Default is continuing. Casualty: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 7.2.1 hereof. Casualty/Condemnation Prepayment: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 2.3.2 hereof. Casualty/Condemnation Reserve: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 3.3.7 hereof.

Sch. 6.3.5-8 KL3 3373582.5 Change in Law: shall mean (a) the adoption of any law, rule or regulation after the Closing Date, (b) any change in any law, rule or regulation or in the interpretation or application thereof by any Governmental Authority after the Closing Date or (c) compliance by Lender (or, for purposes of Section 2.5 by any lending office of Lender or by its holding company, if any) with any request, guideline or directive (whether or not having the force of law) of any Governmental Authority made or issued after the Closing Date. Clearing Account: shall mean deposit account number 1504805723, which shall be an Eligible Account, maintained by Borrower at the Deposit Bank and subject to the Clearing Account Agreement, and which shall include a post office box for the collection of checks and other physical remittances. Clearing Account Agreement: shall mean that certain Deposit Account Control Agreement between Lender, Borrower and the Deposit Bank, which shall provide Lender with full dominion and control over the Clearing Account as more particularly described in Section 3.1.1 hereof. Closing Date: shall have the meaning given to such term in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. Closing Date Advance: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 2.1.1 hereof. Code: shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended and as it may be further amended from time to time. Commencement Date: shall mean July 2, 2022; provided, however, that such date shall be extended on a day-for-day basis (not to exceed sixty (60) days in the aggregate) for each day hereafter that the Property is subject to a Force Majeure Event. Complete or Completed: shall mean satisfaction of each of the following conditions, as reasonably determined by Lender and, at Lender’s option, as confirmed by Lender’s Construction Consultant: (i) all Approved Initial CapEx shall have been completed in accordance with the Initial CapEx Approved Plans and Specifications and all Legal Requirements in all material respects; (ii) Lender shall have received a certificate of completion from Borrower (and, if the cost of any particular Approved Initial CapEx exceeds $250,000, a certificate of completion from Borrower’s architect and, if applicable as reasonably determined by Lender, Borrower’s general contractor and/or engineer) attesting to such completion in accordance with the applicable Initial CapEx Approved Plans and Specifications and all Legal Requirements in all material respects; (iii) Lender shall have received evidence of the payment of all costs and expenses of completing the applicable Approved Initial CapEx;

Sch. 6.3.5-9 KL3 3373582.5 (iv) Lender shall have received final lien waivers from all contractors (and all material subcontractors reasonably required by Lender) performing work in connection with the Approved Initial CapEx; (v) Lender shall have received evidence that any applicable building permit has been closed out by the applicable Governmental Authorities; and (vi) Lender shall have received a Title Update. Completion Date: shall mean (x) with respect to the work contemplated by the “Exterior Renovation” and “Deferred Maintenance” portions of the Initial CapEx Budget, December 2, 2023, (y) with respect to the work contemplated by the “Interior Renovation” portion of the Initial CapEx Budget as it relates to not less than eighty-four (84) of the rental units at the Property, June 2, 2024 and (z) with respect to the remainder of the work contemplated by the Initial CapEx Budget, June 2, 2025; provided, however, that such date shall be extended on a day-for- day basis (not to exceed sixty (60) days in the aggregate) for each day hereafter that the Property is subject to a Force Majeure Event; and provided, further, that in no event shall the Completion Date be later than the Maturity Date (as the same may be extended from time to time in accordance with Section 2.9 hereof). Compounded SOFR: shall mean the compounded average of SOFR for approximately a one-month period, with the rate, or methodology for this rate, and conventions for this rate (which, for example, may include compounding in arrears with a lookback and/or suspension period as a mechanism to determine the interest amount payable prior to the end of each Interest Period) being established by Lender in accordance with: (1) the rate, or methodology for this rate, and conventions for this rate selected or recommended by the Relevant Governmental Body for determining compounded SOFR; provided, that (2) if, and to the extent that, Lender determines that Compounded SOFR cannot be determined in accordance with clause (1) above, then “Compounded SOFR” shall mean the rate, or methodology for this rate, and conventions for this rate, selected by Lender giving due consideration to any industry-accepted market practice for U.S. dollar- denominated floating rate CMBS loans at such time; provided, further, that if Lender decides that any such rate, methodology or convention determined in accordance with clause (1) or clause (2) is not administratively feasible for Lender, then Compounded SOFR shall be deemed unable to be determined for purposes of the definition of “Benchmark Replacement.” Condemnation: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 7.3.1 hereof. Control: shall mean, with respect to any Person, either (i) ownership directly or indirectly of forty-nine percent (49%) or more of the outstanding voting securities or voting equity of such Person or (ii) the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such Person, through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise. The terms Controlled, Controlling and Common Control shall

Sch. 6.3.5-10 KL3 3373582.5 have correlative meanings. Covered Taxes: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 2.5 hereof. Debt: shall mean, without duplication, all present and future indebtedness, whether direct or contingent, funded or unfunded, evidenced by or arising under this Agreement with respect to the Loan, or under any other Loan Document, together with interest thereon and all other sums due to Lender in respect of the Loan under any Loan Document (including sums added to the Principal in accordance with the terms of any Loan Document, all Protective Advances, Prepayment Premiums, Late Payment Charges, Exit Fees, Undrawn Commitment Fees, Loan Expenses and all other charges, fees, costs and expenses payable pursuant to any Loan Document). Debt Service: shall mean for any period of time, the sum of all scheduled principal (if any) (except the payment due at the Stated Maturity Date) and interest payments (including scheduled payments of the Undrawn Commitment Fee) on the Loan that are due and payable during such period of time. Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Cash Management): shall mean, as of any date of determination, the ratio calculated by Lender of: (i) In Place NOI; provided that an underwritten reserve holdback equal to $250 per apartment unit at the Property shall be deducted from In Place NOI for purposes of calculating the Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Cash Management) for periods from and after the Payment Date occurring in June, 2025; to (ii) the DSCR Debt Service payable for the succeeding twelve (12) month period beginning with the most recently-completed calendar month. Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Cash Management) shall be determined by Lender based on the financial information provided to Lender by Borrower and reviewed (and if Lender so elects, verified) by Lender. Lender’s determination shall be binding upon Borrower absent manifest error. Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Extension Test): shall mean, as of any date of determination, the ratio calculated by Lender of: (i) In Place NOI; provided that an underwritten reserve holdback equal to $250 per apartment unit at the Property shall be deducted from In Place NOI for purposes of calculating the Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Extension Test); to (ii) the DSCR Debt Service payable for the succeeding twelve (12) month period beginning with the most recently-completed calendar month. Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Extension Test) shall be determined by Lender based on the financial information provided to Lender by Borrower and reviewed (and if Lender so elects, verified) by Lender. Lender’s determination shall be binding upon Borrower absent manifest error. Debt Yield: shall mean, as of any date of determination, the ratio calculated by

Sch. 6.3.5-11 KL3 3373582.5 Lender of: (i) In Place NOI; to (ii) the Principal, plus all accrued and unpaid interest thereon. Debt Yield shall be determined by Lender based on the financial information provided to Lender by Borrower and reviewed (and if Lender so elects, verified) by Lender. Lender’s determination shall be binding upon Borrower absent manifest error. Default: shall mean the occurrence of any event under any Loan Document which, with the giving of notice or passage of time, or both, would be an Event of Default. Default Rate: shall mean a rate per annum equal to the lesser of (i) the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, or (ii) five percent (5%) above the Interest Rate. De Minimis Amounts: shall mean office and cleaning supplies or other materials customarily used in the ordinary course of Borrower’s business or by tenants, in each case in reasonably minimal amounts, taking into account the intended and proper use thereof, properly containerized and labeled and stored, transported, disposed of and used in a manner that does not violate Environmental Law. Deposit Bank: shall mean Signature Bank, a New York commercial bank, or such other bank or depository selected by Lender in its discretion. Distribution: means any distribution of cash by Borrower or Sole Member to any Person having any direct or indirect legal or beneficial interest in Borrower or Sole Member, pursuant to such Person’s interest in Borrower or Sole Member. Disclosure Document: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 9.1.2 hereof. DSCR Cash Management Period: shall mean any period following the Payment Date occurring in August, 2022 that the Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Cash Management) is less than 1.15:1.00, and ending upon the earlier to occur of either of the following: (i) the Calculation Date thereafter that Lender determines that the Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Cash Management) was equal to or exceeded 1.20:1.00 for the immediately preceding two (2) consecutive Quarters or (ii) the date upon which Borrower makes a partial prepayment of Principal pursuant to Section 3.4.5 within ten (10) Business Days after Lender notifies Borrower that such DSCR Cash Management Period has commenced, resulting in the Debt Service Coverage Ratio (Cash Management) as of the Calculation Dates for the two (2) Quarters immediately preceding such Calculation Date being increased to not less than 1.20:1.00. DSCR Debt Service: means, for any period of time, the sum of (i) all scheduled principal payments on the Loan that are due and payable during such period of time (if any), plus (ii) all interest payments on the Loan (including scheduled payments of the Undrawn Commitment Fee) that would be due and payable during such period of time based on the Interest Rate in effect on such date of determination.

Sch. 6.3.5-12 KL3 3373582.5 Easements: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 4.14 hereof. Eligible Account: shall mean a separate and identifiable account from all other funds held by the holding institution that is acceptable to Lender and is either (i) an account or accounts (or subaccounts thereof) maintained with a federal or state-chartered depository institution or trust company which complies with the definition of Eligible Institution or (ii) a segregated trust account or accounts (or subaccounts thereof) which is insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and maintained with the corporate trust department of a federal depository institution or state chartered depository institution subject to regulations regarding fiduciary funds on deposit similar to Title 12 of the Code of Federal Regulations §9.10(b), having in either case corporate trust powers, acting in its fiduciary capacity, and a combined capital and surplus of at least $50,000,000 and subject to supervision or examination by federal and state authorities. An Eligible Account will not be evidenced by a certificate of deposit, passbook or other instrument. Eligible Institution: shall mean a depository institution insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation the short term unsecured debt obligations or commercial paper of which are rated at least A-1 by S&P, P-1 by Moody’s and F-1+ by Fitch, in the case of accounts in which funds are held for thirty (30) days or less or, in the case of Letters of Credit or accounts in which funds are held for more than thirty (30) days, the long term unsecured debt obligations of which are rated at least (i) “AA” by S&P, (ii) “AA” and/or “F1+” (for securities) and/or “AAAmmf” (for money market funds), by Fitch and (iii) “Aa2” by Moody’s. Environmental Indemnity: shall mean that certain Environmental Indemnity Agreement made by Borrower and Guarantor for the benefit of Lender, dated as of the Closing Date, as the same may be amended, restated or supplemented from time to time. Environmental Laws: shall have the meaning given to such term in Section 4.21 hereof. Equipment: shall have the meaning given to such term in the Security Instrument. ERISA: shall mean the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended from time to time, and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder. ERISA Affiliate: shall mean all members of a controlled group of corporations and all trades and business (whether or not incorporated) under common control and all other entities which, together with Borrower, are treated as a single employer under any or all of Section 414(b), (c), (m) or (o) of the Code or Title IV of ERISA.
